answers.answer: You are having serious issues.  It sounds like you have something like diabetes or Celiac disease or malnutrition for some other reason.  Are you constipated?   If so, start magnesium citrate 750 mg every day.  Take vitamin D 2000 IU and get out in the sun without sunscreen as often as you can for at least 30 minutes unless you burn sooner.  You seem to have yeast overgrowth.  Eat vegetables and stop sugar.  No soda drinks at all.  You need to see a primary care doctor to assess you and get lab work and get to the bottom of this.  You can use tea tree oil soap to start cleaning up your skin.

question: Hi people or doctors. It's my first time being on a medical  forum. I'm facing this certain problem, I am unable to get erection at all. Even when I masturbate, my penis remains limp but I can ejaculate after a minute of stroking. I am a virgin and have never made out with a girl. I just turned 22 last month but I am having this issue since 4 years. I didn't pay attention to it thinking it would get better. Everyday I feel the urge to have sex that is I get excited but can't get erect. I then masturbate with limp erection cause there is no other way of relieving my sexual tension. I also have this problem that I need to urinate more frequently. I feel thirsty but if I drink water I need to urinate frequently. Even when i get that limp erection, I feel the urge to urinate. I was thinking of trying a Viagra pill and did a bit of search on erectile dysfunction and the causes mentioned were cardiovascular problems or brain related problems or kidney failure and this got me worried all of a sudden. What could be the reason? I really hope it is not something serious related to my heart or brain or kidney. By the way, I once had checked my blood and there was no excess amount of sugar present so I don't think I have diabetes since it also can induce ED. I also have this jock itch like problem since a year. The skin on my thighs has turned black and scaly and it feels itchy. The itching increases when sweat forms down there. The black patch has spread to the anus and is present on the scrotum and half of my penis too. What could be this, jock itch? Eczema? Could these two things be related? What should I do next? See a urologist and skin expert both?
title: I'm 22 can't get erection not even by physical stimulation but can ejaculate.
